items.title: Dilip Buildcon shares surge 4% after firm wins Rs 1,341-crore order from Konkan Railway
items.description: Dilip Buildcon share price: Nearly 6.99 lakh shares of the company were involved in active trade today, which is nearly double of its 10-day average volumes

items.title: Taking Stock: Bulls back in action; Sensex up 1,046 pts, Nifty above 25,100
items.description: All the sectoral indices ended in the green, with metal, PSU Bank, realty, power, telecom, capital goods up 1-2 percent.

items.title: Godrej Properties experiences 1.72% surge amid high trading volumes
items.description: The increase in Godrej Properties shares aligns with positive investor sentiment, supported by consistent financial performance and overall growth trajectory.

items.title: Man Infra incorporates subsidiary, shares rise over 2%
items.description: Man Infra Forms Subsidiary 'MICL Shreepati August LLP'

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Top stocks that moved the most on June 20
items.description: From Bharti Airtel to Sai Life Sciences, here are the top stocks that moved the most on June 20

items.title: Live: Nifty Reclaims 25,000 As Friday Rally Lifts Mood; Midcaps Back With A Bang| Closing Bell
items.description: Bulls make a comeback as Nifty reclaims 25,000. Very solid recovery in midcaps. Midcap index outperforms; surges 1.5%. Advance-decline ratio at 2:1. Realty, metals & psu banks among top gainers. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Mayuresh Joshi, Head of Equity Research, William O’Neil India and Ashish Bahety--Technical and Derivative Research Analyst.

items.title: Mutual fund assets double to 31% of bank deposits in 10 years, Uday Kotak says savers turning investors
items.description: Kotak pointed out that prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, mutual funds accounted for only a modest share of household savings in India.

items.title: Swiggy, Hyundai, Waaree Energies, other stocks jump up to 8% after inclusion into London's FTSE index
items.description: FTSE rejig: Bucking the trend, Vishal Mega Mart shares dropped over 1% to trade in the red at Rs 125 apiece.

items.title: Ashish Kacholia-backed Aeroflex Industries shares rally 29% in three sessions on value buying
items.description: Aeroflex Industries share price: Since listing, the stock has gained over 100% from its IPO price.

items.title: Shares acquired in FY25 but credited in FY26, which year will the acquisition be counted? SEBI clears the air
items.description: The share purchase trades were done in March but due to 3 days of trading holiday, the shares were credited in demat of the acquiring company in April which is the next financial year, hence a clarification was sought about provisions of SEBI's takeover code.

items.title: Sensex up 650 pts, Nifty at 25,000 as all sectors rally; India VIX eases nearly 6%
items.description: The broader market staged a strong rebound, with the midcap and smallcap indices snapping a three-day losing streak and rising nearly 1 percent each.

items.title: Mid, smallcap indices jump 1% to snap 3-day losing streak: Waaree Energies, IREDA, RailTel, others surge up to 6%
items.description: Broader markets: Analysts noted that the earlier drop in the stock prices were driven by profit booking following a record run.

items.title: Bharti Airtel Stock Hits Fresh 52-Week High, Jumps Over 2% on NSE Today
items.description: Bharti Airtel's stock performance reflects its robust market position and financial health, making it a notable performer in today's trading session.

items.title: Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp shares fall over 2% as China's rare earth exports drop 53% in May
items.description: Rare earth permanent magnet exports dropped to just 1,238 metric tons in May, down almost 53 percent from April and marking the lowest monthly tally since February 2020.

items.title: Weekly Tactical Pick: This power company offers a good blend of earnings, valuations
items.description: The company’s business is improving across the value chain and the stock has corrected quite a bit in the last 7-8 months

items.title: Kaynes Tech shares jump 2% after firm launches QIP to raise up to Rs 1,600 crore
items.description: Kaynes Tech share price: While the stock is down nearly 25% in 2025 so far, it had jumped nearly 51% in the past one year.

items.title: Nifty PSU Bank snaps 3-day losing streak, rises on RBI's project finance push
items.description: PSU banks rally as RBI slashes provisioning norms for project loans; analysts see lending revival and profitability boost

items.title: Delhivery shares drop 3% on Jefferies downgrade, sees another 8% potential fall
items.description: Delhivery shares fell after Jefferies downgraded the stock to “underperform” from “buy,” citing downside risks from Meesho’s insourcing move and a slower growth outlook for the express parcel industry

items.title: Sensex surges 750 pts, Nifty reclaims 25,000 as RIL, HDFC Bank lead rally; India VIX eases 4%
items.description: The broader market rebounded after a brief dip, aligning with the overall positive momentum.

items.title: United Spirits shares gain as it fully acquires NAO Spirits in Rs 130 crore deal
items.description: United Spirits will acquire full ownership of NAO Spirits, maker of Greater Than and Hapusa gins, in a Rs 130 crore deal, raising its stake to 97.07 percent by June 2025 and completing the buyout by 2026

items.title: Will Nifty Manage A Positive Close For The Week? Sai Life Block Deal Likely| Opening Bell Live
items.description: The Nifty 50 closed 19 points lower after a choppy trading session, continuing its southward journey for the third consecutive session amid fears of an escalating Iran-Israel conflict and cautious commentary from the Federal Reserve. Experts believe that if this level is decisively breached, the 24,500–24,450 zone becomes a crucial support area to watch. On the upside, the 25,000 mark remains a critical hurdle for any further upward movement. The GIFT Nifty meanwhile is hinting at a muted start. Watch out for PSU lenders and NBFCs after RBI eases project finance rules. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader & Kunal Valia, Founder of StatLane.
